conclusion: Analyze the paths of liquid from points A, B, C, and D to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid from A flows down the black path and follows the white path to the left.
Liquid from B flows down the brown path and follows the purple path to the center.
Liquid from C flows down the pink path and follows the orange path to the right.
Liquid from D flows down the yellow path and follows the gray path to the right.
White path from A leads to the leftmost container.
Purple path from B leads to the center container.
Orange path from C leads to the rightmost container.
Gray path from D leads to the rightmost container.
C and D lead to G (rightmost container).
Liquid from A, B, C, and D will flow into containers E, F, and G respectively.
